title.narrative: Community Engagement For Slum Upgrading Within The Health System Strategy In Songinokhairkhan District, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia

description.narrative:
The main objectives of the project include capacity building and community organization for the delivery of safe, good quality, continued and accessible health care and services, improve knowledge and attitudes of people to prevent diseases, and create healthy environment by mobilizing inclusion of health issues into urban environment and to service and infrastructure planning in ger areas, and strengthening partnerships between national and other partner organizations in district health issues. The project approach addresses the links of poor health records of ger area residents as evident in the sector statistics and the poor housing, environmental and service conditions in ger areas. The leading causes of morbidity of the population include respiratory diseases, digestive system diseases, cardiovascular diseases, urinary tract diseases and injuries. The leading causes of mortality are cardiovascular diseases, cancer, digestive system diseases, respiratory diseases, neurology diseases and perinatal disorders. [1]
[1] Strategy of Health System Strengthening in Songinokhairkhan District 2014-2016, 2014

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Communities in the ger settlements of the Songinohairkhan district are actively and meaningfully engaged in the implementation of the Strategy of Health System Strengthening

title.narrative: Community members organized into CDCs with capacity to analyze their own situation and analyze and prioritize their needs, collaborate with partners to participate in all project procedures, mobilize their members to provide contributions to the project and continuously engage with partners on related matters

title.narrative: CDCs organized with systems and policies in place on how to work together to analyze their health-related situation and other issues, priortise needs including for health, validate plans prepared by external support actors and maintain dialogue with partners to resolve issues
